title: LEARNING INDICATORS
subTitle: SELECT THE TYPE OF REPORT YOU WANT
iap_textTop: The Performance Index (IAp) represents the percentage of correct answers a student receives in an activity. It is calculated by dividing the number of correct answers by the total number of attempts made.
iap_textBottom: This means that, on average, for every 10 attempts, the student gets 7 right.
ica_textTop: The Learning Consolidation Index shows how well a student has mastered a given piece of content, considering not only correct answers but also the frequency with which they practice the activity. In other words, the more often they access and maintain good scores, the higher the index will be.
ica_text1: • Student A: did the activity once and got everything right → High IAp, but low I.C.A., because there is no consistency.
ica_text2: • Student B: did the activity 10 times and maintained good scores → high IAp and high I.C.A., showing real mastery.
ica_text3: • Student C: did the activity 10 times, but got few answers right → low IAp and low I.C.A., needs reinforcement.
ica_textG1: • Who got it right by chance or just in one attempt.
ica_textG2: • Who really consolidated the learning with practice and repetition.
